Inadequate teacher training: Teachers may not be adequately trained to teach the new curriculum.
Resistance from students and parents: Students and parents may resist changing the established curriculum.
Curriculum inadequacy: The new curriculum may not be suitable for some students or may leave some students behind.
Time constraints: Implementing a new curriculum may require a significant amount of time and effort.
Inadequate planning: The school may not have proper planning in place to implement the new curriculum.
